sentences: Houston Person (born November 10, 1934) is an American jazz tenor saxophonist and record producer.
He received the Eubie Blake Jazz Award in 1982.
Person grew up in Florence, South Carolina, and first played piano before switching to tenor saxophone.
He studied at South Carolina State College where he was inducted into the school's Hall of Fame in 1999.
In the United States Air Force, he joined a service band stationed in West Germany, and played with Don Ellis, Eddie Harris, Cedar Walton, and Leo Wright.

Contrary to popular belief, he was never married to the vocalist Etta Jones, but did spend many years as her musical partner, recording, performing and touring, and for much of his career this association was what he was best known for.
There are more than 75 albums recorded by Houston Person as a bandleader, on Prestige, Westbound, Mercury, Savoy, and Muse, and he has most recently been recording on HighNote.
Something in Common (Muse, 1989 [1990]) - with Ron Carter
Just Friends (Muse, 1990 [1992]) -with Buddy Tate and Nat Simkins
Randy Johnston, Etta Jones, Grady Tate, Benny Green [note: reissued as Santa Baby on Savoy in 2003]
To Etta with Love (HighNote, 2004) -with Paul Bollenback
Soothin' 'N Groovin' with The 3B's (3B's Music, 1994)With Gene Ammons
Paul Brown Quartet Meets The Three Tenors (Brownstone, 1998)With Billy Butler
Profoundly Blue (Muse, 1973)With Peter Hand Big Band
My Buddy: Etta Jones Sings the Songs of Buddy Johnson (HighNote, 1998)
Etta Jones Sings Lady Day (HighNote, 2001)With Charles Kynard
